scene_target: Artie survives the gate inspection at Oakhaven and enters the hub.
goal: Introduce the town's RNG-obsessed culture and trigger the 'Statistical Anomaly' flag.
conflict: The guards' gate scanner cannot process Artie's 100% Crit Rate and 1 HP, causing a system-wide alert.
end_condition: Artie is allowed entry into Oakhaven while the 'Statistical Anomaly' alarm sounds throughout the district.

set.reason: Entered Oakhaven; stamina depletion from running and stress. Gained exploration XP.

persona_updates: Artie is now recognized by the System (and the public) as a 'Statistical Anomaly'.
Fizz is oscillating between professional guide duties and morbid curiosity regarding how the gate scanners will handle Artie's glitched stats.

global_continuity_system_updates.reason: Statistical Anomaly detected by Oakhaven Gate Scanner; cursed trophy effect amplified.

inventory_alignment_updates.reason: Entered Oakhaven; maintaining custody of the cursed trophy.
Entered Oakhaven; guidebook held for navigation.

chapter_so_far_add: Artie entered Oakhaven, triggering a massive system-wide alert due to his glitched stats.
key_events: Artie approached Oakhaven while holding the cursed Participation Trophy.
The Gate Scanner (DEVICE_gate_scanner) failed to process Artie's 1 HP and 100% Crit Rate.
A 'Statistical Anomaly' System Alert was triggered, sounding throughout the district.
Guards Harlen and Silas witnessed Artie's glitched build and allowed him through the gate.
Artie discovered the Oakhaven location and gained 250 XP.
last_scene: Artie and Fizz reached the Oakhaven gates, where Artie's glitched stats caused the Gate Scanner to malfunction and trigger a city-wide alarm.
Despite the alert, the guards allowed them entry to prevent a System crash, leaving Artie in the middle of a city that now knows he is an anomaly.
